lesson.title_and_level: Upper-Intermediate - Preparing to give an Interview

sentence.idiomatic: If we were to choose from amongst us a torch bearer, you definitely would be the perfect candidate.
The company has still not found a suitable candidate to take over your job.
Has the candidate to look after this project been determined yet?
He did marketing before.
How is the sales situation with the new product?
A lot of people came to purchase an apartment today. In a few short hours more than 10 suites were sold.
Let me have a look at this person's background information.
Just as soon as he graduated he was able to get on with this company. It seems like his family must have a lot of connections.
He is a young guy from the village. He doesn't have any kind of connections, he has to completely rely on his own hard work.
In the next few years the government wants to focus on developing this region.
I've heard that that company is secretly developing a new software.
Only doing business with our old customers is not enough. We need to constantly develop new customers.
This medicine is really effective. As soon as I took it the pain went away.
Instituting an appropriate plan can effectively raise work efficiency.
At this meeting we want to discuss how to effectively reduce production costs.
I want to give her a huge surprise she would never expect by proposing to her on her birthday.
You should always be able to predict in advance to some degree whether the outcome will be good or bad.
We could have predicted that he would do something like this.
He is always hemming and hawing over things; he is lacking in the ability to take charge.
Although he hasn't been with the company long, he has taken charge of a lot of things.
Your parents cannot help you solve your problems forever. You should learn how to take the bull by the horns.
Mr. Wang, tomorrow afternoon we have arranged for you to conducts an interview for a project manager.
OK. Are there any candidates you feel are suitable?
I think there is one person that is a good fit.
Tell me about his particular situation.

He is American, and he specializes in marketing. He has lived and worked in China for over four years, and was previously doing sales at a French company. He's been involved in some successful marketing campaigns, for example...
His background is good. His Chinese should be pretty good.
It should be. He speaks French, English, Chinese, and Spanish.
Good, we want to develop this project with customers in western countries, so linguistic competence is very important.
He is also familiar with E-commerce, so he can effectively launch our internet sales.
We need just such a person with these kinds of qualifications.
However, he has never been a marketing project manager.
His project managing experience is lacking, but his ability to adapt ought to be relatively strong. Living abroad like this one will encounter many unexpected difficulties.

word.literal: to go on a business trip

sentence.idiomatic: He also said he likes a challenge, and has no problem with working overtime and going on business trips.
Doing marketing requires one to go all over the place. People skills are very important. Drinking, singing, and playing golf are also very useful.
He enjoys playing baseball and football, and also like to swim.
Not many people play baseball and football in this country. What kind of salary is he expecting?
He is requesting a base pay slightly over our budget.

This can be discussed further; besides, the commission from sales is the major part. Being bold enough to state such a high salary is a sign of confidence. The most important thing is that he has the ability to take charge of a department, as well as communication skills and charisma.
Hmm. I have written down on his resume some more things you need to find out about. He is coming to interview tomorrow morning at 11:00am. When he arrives, I'll let you know.
OK.
